headline: Chocolate Waffles
description: These chocolate waffles are a favorite. They offer a fun flavor variation on traditional waffles with a touch of cocoa. They are light and fluffy.
name: Chocolate Waffles

recipeInstructions.text: Make waffles: Stir together flour, sugar, cocoa, baking powder, and salt in a large mixing bowl. Stir in milk, eggs, and butter until the mixture is smooth.
Make hard sauce: stir together softened butter, confectioners' sugar, vanilla extract, and milk. Sauce should be fairly stiff. Set aside.
Spray preheated waffle iron with nonstick cooking spray. Pour waffle mix onto hot waffle iron. Cook until golden brown. Serve hot with hard sauce.

review.reviewBody: These turned out great. A lot of people saying they're not chocolate enough or sweet enough, waffles are meant to be topped with sweet items so they themselves aren't supposed to be super sweet. These were fluffy and did taste great as the recipe was. Thank you!
I made the chances Lissalu suggested, they are great! Thank you
Ohhh so delicious!! The hard sauce is a bit too sweet but the combo taste great together
These waffles were very light, fluffy and delicious. I put some white chocolate chips on the top and it gave it that little bit of sweetness. 10/10 recommend.
It’s perfect
My family loved these waffles! I added vanilla extract and Chia/Hemp/Flax seeds and a few mini chocolate chips. Oh yes they were great.

This was an incredibly thick batter to make by hand with a whisk. But surprisingly the waffles came out soft and fluffy. I thought the sugar amount was high but for the six large waffles ?? it made I really didn’t feel like it was overpowering. I really don’t like how prep is always 5 min, to gather ingredients and then actually prep the batter for cooking took over 15 min. I would just be transparent about that, maybe a busy parent is trying to make them.
Absolutely amazing
Pretty good. Didn’t use the sauce recipe but used whipped cream.
With the exception of adding a little more milk, I made them exactly as is and they were a big hit. I had no problem tasting the chocolate and everyone loved them. I will definitely make them again.
This is the worst receipe. Not enough wet ingredients to make a batter

Waffles were very good. Did not make the topping.

Had an issue with adjusting the servings. Adjusted it to 15 servings and the milk was listed as 1 1/2 teaspoons instead of 1 1/2 cups.
We make these waffles every other week. We make them as is. The kids love them with strawberry jam and whipped cream.
I made it but I wouldn’t waste my time with this recipe because it tasted like regular waffles.

According to my 14-year-old, this was like having chocolate lava cake for breakfast. Huge hit. I followed the suggestions of LISSALU and went with the 2 tsp of baking powder, 1/2 cup of dark chocolate cocoa powder, 1/2 tsp of baking soda, and 1 tsp of vanilla. I had a nervous moment because the batter seemed more like brownie batter or muffin batter (very thick) but when I put it on the waffle irons, it turned out to be really wonderful. We cooked a Belgian and we made smaller ones on the Dash waffle iron and both were great. My girls asked for this recipe to go into the regular rotation for “fun breakfasts”.
The sauce was a bit too sweet for me but overall it was delicious.
Kids loved them! Didn’t do the hard glaze, but did use whipped cream on top instead. Also threw in some chocolate chips to the recipe.
The waffle tasted great, but they didn't really taste like chocolate. Not sure if I used a different brand of Coco powder or something else went wrong. Still good.

Made these tonight for birthday dinner. I omitted one teaspoon of baking powder since i use self rise flour and added a tablespoon of cocoa. They were really good. I cooked the rest of the batter and froze the cooked waffles to toast later.

These were great. I did have to add a bit less batter to my waffle maker because it would overflow. I used the mini waffle maker so 3tbsp of batter instead of 4. I used the hard sauce and added strawberries, my family was super happy with this wonderful dessert.

The flavor was good but the texture was super dense. I added a bit more cocoa powder and a tiny bit less baking powder as I don't like the baking powder aftertaste so maybe that contributed to it. The second waffle I added chocolate chips and that made them a little better.
Very delicious! Made without the syrup and it still came out great!!!

I used garbanzo bean flour instead of white flour, and splenda instead of sugar. Oh and 3 eggs instead of 2 because my 3 year old grandson was helping lolol Ihad to pick out shells. They were delicious I will definitely make them again.
It was good! Loved it with some peanut butter sauce! Yum!
I didn't use confectioner's sugar and it still works fine.
The waffles don’t really taste like chocolate at all it was kind of disappointing??????but if they weren’t supposed to be chocolate they were pretty good??

This is a great recipe. The only thing I did different was separate the eggs. I whipped the egg whites to a peak and folded them into the batter. I have a feeling this will be a do over many times. Put some fresh fruit on top and enjoy.
I didn’t make the sauce but it still was delicious
I'd make it again!! I made it for my twin brothers and the enjoyed it! I didn't it chocolate sauce on mine and I thought it was amazing
Best chocolate waffles recipe!

This made a super decadent Sunday morning breakfast. Based on others comments and my previous experience with my Belgian waffle iron, I added 2 extra T of cocoa for more chocolatey goodness, used veg oil instead of melted butter, added 1 t of vanilla, 1/4 c extra milk and beat the egg whites separately to add a bit of lift to the waffles. They turned out crisp and moist. My teenagers smeared choc hazelnut spread and peanut butter before sandwiching two together. Topped with the best Canadian maple syrup, it was pure decadence.
Delicious!!!
BOOM!
1/4 cup more flour, 1/4 cup less sugar, 1/4 tsp vanilla
I added 4 tablespoons of then only added 1 cup flour then 1/2 cup ground flaxseed. I did put a 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla in the batter. Even added 1/2 cup of chocolate chips. Very tasty!

I would add more stars but I didn’t follow the ingredients. I read the reviews before I made this and changed the ratio of cocoa powder and baking powder. Turned out great. Not sure about people saying it was chewy. I made sure it was on the waffle maker until it had a nice texture.

Waffles good. Sauce too much vanilla and more like what would put on cinnamon rolls. My daughter ate plain and I put sliced strawberries and a little whip cream. We put rest in freezer. Mine got crispy on the outside. Can see it with scoop of ice cream for dessert!
Easy, delicious recipe. Substituted olive oil for butter.

I made this with my eleven year old son this morning. We loved them! He added sprinkles to the batter and sprinkles to the sauce. My only extra comment is that the sauce was more like frosting and we spread it on like a knife. So good!

The first time I made it, the only change I made was that I added 1/2 t cinnamon. They were good. The second time I followed someone's advice and used oil and added the cinnamon. We all felt they had a chocolate cake doughnut flavor. My oldest really likes them, so we will keep it like that. Very easy to make. However, next time I may try to incorporate buttermilk, sour cream or yogurt to help moisten them.
UPDATE: I switched the milk to 1 1/2 c. buttermilk and about 2/3 c. milk and it did help moisten the waffles, but my kids liked the cake doughnut flavor over the more moist waffle. (This was for a double batch.)
11/12- Okay, just follow the directions- for a Belgium waffle, cook 5- 6 min. MAKE THE SAUCE! You have oreo waffles - kids love them!

I had high hopes for these but they were just disgusting, I followed the recipe exactly. But once all the ingredients were added there were clumps of flour that didn't mix properly, I sat there and mixed forever and still nothing. I decided to try and make one and it tasted horrible. It wasn't thick at all it was as liquidy as milk. Wouldn't give this recipe to my worst enemy.

Delicious as a special Christmas Day breakfast! I followed the recipe except added about 4 T of chocolate chips. Everyone raved about them! We added fresh strawberries and raspberries, whipped cream and more chocolate chips for toppings! I think I saw some reviewers say it was too sweet or not chocolaty enough, and I disagree (but I did add chips!) I thought the texture was wonderful and have saved this recipe and will definitely make again! Would also make for a wonderful dessert. You can make a several waffles and keep warm in a toaster oven so that you can serve a bunch at once.

So the best and easiest thing about making waffles is to follow the waffle recipe on the packaging of instant pancake mix to a T (down to using a measuring cup to measure out cold water) and using a waffle iron. Perfect waffles are a snap — so easy and quick. I followed this recipe in the sense that I just added 2 tsp cocoa powder and 1/4 cup chocolate chips. Kids love it! Will definitely make again!
Made it as is, worked out very well. Do not usually make the topping. By the way these freeze very well.

Good chocolate recipe. Added chocolate chips for an extra treat. Made recipe as is. My only complaint would be that they don't come out crispy on the outside like most do, but that wouldn't deter me from making again. Doubled the recipe and got about 18 waffles (9 in grandma's double iron).
awesome and fluffy!
So good! I loved it, and so did the rest of my family.
Yummmy
Very good, but a little too sweet. The topping is basically just icing.
I have not made it yet but it looks good so I'll make it for my sister.

Excellent recipe! Simple and delicious! My boys loved them. I love that I only needed to use one bowl and it wasn't a lot to clean up. The batter was perfect! This will be my go to waffle recipe! --I did not make the sauce.

These were so yummy, I will definitely make them again. I did make some changes, like suggested, I put less baking powder and then a teaspoon of baking soda. I also used a 1/2 C of cocoa powder and added some chocolate chips. These turned out really, really yummy.
Absolutely great!
These are the best waffles I have every had, and they are even better with chocolate chips!

Delicious! I made half the waffle recipe to try it out. I used just a pinch of salt and added 1/2 tsp vanilla to the batter. I made the icing as directed. Yielded 2.5 waffles in my Belgian waffle maker.
I added 2 tbsp maca to the recipe along with a tsp of vanilla (didnt make the sauce) and an extra tbsp of cocoa powser.

I made this tonight. It was just ok. I followed the recipe exactly, but only made the waffles. I did not make the sauce. Maybe the secret to flavor is in the sauce?. Really, the chocolate taste is lacking. It honestly didn't have much taste at all. However, after topped with cool whip and powdered sugar it tasted pretty good. Also, this is not a flae in the recipe as it most likelya calls for a standard waffle iron, if making belgium waffles it only makes 4-5. I probably would not make this again.

I judged the waffles by the picture, big mistake. Sure when I made them they looked and smelled fantastic but when you try them....not so appetizing. The waffle tasted strange, it was sweet but in a bad way. So I rated this recipe 2 stars because they tasted like a bad chocolate cake.
They tasted good. The waffles were a bit too tough for me though.

they were ok, not very crunchy I added chocolate chips and peanut butter. They need ice cream or fudge sauce (just mix 250mls 1 cup thin cream,1/2 cup brown sugar,2 tbsp golden syrup,20g 1 tbsp butter,200g dark cooking chocolate, 1 tsp vanilla essence
Replaced the milk with soy milk. The result was very heavy until I added an additional 1/4 cup of soy milk to get the consistency right. The taste was very good.
Very good. Followed the recipe exactly. Made 2 batches of waffles in my waffle iron for a total of 8 square waffles / 4 servings.
my hubby and 6 year old took one bit and didn't have more. Followed recipe.
If you like chocolate and waffles, you will love these! Great with strawberries and the hard sauce is perfect.

These were yum! I added 1/4 C more cocoa powder and subtracted the same amount of flour. After I made one and tasted it, I added 3/4t vanilla and a little more sugar. Also used oil instead of butter. I skipped the 'hard sauce' and instead made simple syrup with sliced strawberries as a sauce. The only reason I gave this 4 out of 5 stars is it wouldn't have been chocolatey enough for me as written, and the vanilla was a great addition. Hubby said it would be better for dessert than breakfast-but that was HIS opinion. For a dessert, I'd also add fresh whipped cream! My waffle iron gave me 8 or so waffles, so I wrapped the extras in parchment and put them in a freezer bag and froze them.
Fantastic! My family loves them with the hard sauce. Although the number of servings is a bit off... 5 servings only feeds 2 people at my house.

I used WW pastry flour, raw sugar, coconut milk and coconut oil. I also added some vanilla. I know some people grip about giving 5 stars to a recipe you make changes to, but I always make changes. We topped them with sliced bananas and coconut syrup.

I love these waffles! I have made them 3 times in the past week and every time they have turned out wonderfully. I read the reviews before I first made them and took another poster's advice and used 1/4 cup of cocoa instead of the few Tbspoons that the recipe calls for. I have a family of chocaholics that I knew would appreciate the chocolatier taste. I ran out of cocoa by makin them so much and decided to swap out the cocoa for cinnamon. I went by the recipe for them and kept to the 3 Tbs for the cinnamon. They were wonderful as well. A great recipe and a family favorite already!

this was TOTAL hit!!! i didn't make the sauce because there is way too much sugar and fat. Just added some regular pancake syrup. My two picky boys LOVED it!!! Freezing the leftovers and DEFINITELY making again!!!
Very yum! My kids loved them I didn't change anything about the recipe and it worked perfectly.

This was excellent. I just made it for some stay-over house-guests, and everyone was very happy. Let's be honest though, It's chocolate cake shaped like a waffle. I added semi-sweet chocolate chips, and a piece of a dark chocolate bar chopped up. I called them "Triple-chocolate waffles".

One complaint, the sauce seemed too thick to do anything with. I added a splash more milk, making a nice creamy sauce. I dusted the waffles with confectioner's sugar and then drizzled the sauce over them before serving.
These were just ok, not very chocolatie and thr "hard sauce" was a little to sweet. Probably will not make again, preschooler would only eat the hard sauce and left the waffle.
I used 1/4 cup cocoa. Very chocolately.

I made this for breakfast this morning and thought it was amazing! I didn't make the hard sauce (too many calories in that), but instead just buttered them and used Aunt Jemima 100 calorie/serving syrup. My 3 yr old ate them up! As did I and my husband. We will be making these again! :)

I loved these. I like the recipe the way it is, though I skipped the chocolate sauce, and I like the softer texture of the waffles, while my husband likes them slightly crispier and leaves them on the waffle iron a little extra longer. These taste good with chocolate, butterscotch, caramel and strawberry syrups and would also taste good with peanut butter, powdered sugar, jams, fruits and berries.

Awesome taste! So good! Easy to prepare. A nice light chocolate taste and cake-like. This is a keeper! I served mine w/ butter and powdered sugar which tripled the yum factor. I didn't change a thing! Thanks Jenny69 for this perfect recipe!!
Very good, and they freeze well for later eating. Next time I cook these I will review the helpful comments below to crisp these up more.
We made these for Valentine Day, which was also my mom's birthday and she loves chocolate. We used a belgian waffle maker and they came out delicious. Great texture!
SO GOOD!...A perfect Valentines day breakfast...used whole white wheat flour to make it a little more heart healthy...my family loved it....THANK U!

How interesting - I don't think I'd ever even heard of such a thing before. I made them exactly as written, and they turned out pretty well. At breakfast-time, the waffles' flavor reminded me of "Cocoa Puffs" cereal, in a non-crunchy waffle form. I didn't know what the "hard sauce" was going to be - another new phrase to me - but it turned out to be kind of like the frosting or glaze that's usually on top of a batch of cinnamon rolls. Upon reflection, I think the hard sauce is probably a much better companion than maple syrup might have been. This didn't quite "wow" me, but it was very good, and a nice departure from the usual waffles. My yield was almost 6 waffles, by the way. I recommend this recipe, and just might make them again some time.

Really really really good. I doubled the recipe so we can have left overs for breakfast over the next few days. Kids already ate some for "lunch" today. I did not make the frosting and it was still so good. Thanks for sharing!
Delish! Instead of the hard sauce I put sliced strawberries and whipped cream on top.

Kids loved, loved, loved these. I would consider these more of a dessert rather than breakfast, but let the kids pick what they wanted today. I added in some mini chocolate chips and 2 of my kids had these with peanut butter and called them Reeses waffles. Probably won't be something I will make them very often, but the recipe is very good.

Followed the recipe exactly & they turned out very well..made 3 7in. round waffles. I would describe the texture as more pancake like but my kids loved them. I made the hard sauce which is basically an icing & they loved it. I would try them with strawberries & whipped cream next time. 
Very easy recipe & I will be making these again.
i made these for my daughter and she loved them! She kept asking me for more!

Good but not real sweet. I ended up changing a few things due to goodies we had on hand and all I can say is wow that was an awesome dessert! First I used coconut butter instead of melted butter in a silly attempt to make them slightly healthier. Then I used the new dark chocolate cocoa powder and made a syrup with it too by adding about 1T coconut butter, 1T cocoa, 2T Agave and some water to thin. We ate ours with whipped cream coconut shreds, the chocolate syrup, and a few pecan pieces. OMG to die for! My 2.5 year old ate 2 without batting an eye. I would say it was a hit!

We loved these. I did use 2 t baking powder and 1/2 t baking soda, and 1/4 cup cocoa as suggested. I also used 4 T canola oil and 1 t vanilla. They did not stick. For breakfast I served them with powdered sugar. I used the leftovers to make ice cream sandwiches - yummy.
Delicious. Did not make the hard sauce, but will try next time.

yum yum! I used 1/4 cup of cocoa powder, 2 tsp of baking powder, 1/2 tsp of baking soda, and oil instead of melted butter. I freeze them and then pop them into the toaster. Crunchy outside, soft inside with great chocolaty flavor.
My daughter absolutely love these waffles!

Tasty recipe! Our waffles did not turn out like the ones in the picture and we added more milk as the batter was very thick and did not spread throughout the waffle pan. All in all though a good recipe
Very good! Still relatively light and fluffy despite the addition of chocolate. One of the kids topped hers with peanut butter--very clever! I doubled the recipe and am going to freeze the remainder.
Yummy! I add chocolate chips to mine also for an extra chocolaty boost!
My family (that normally loves chocolate) would prefer regular waffles. This also made a mess of my waffle iron.

SO GOOD! Loved these! I followed the changes that the 2nd most recent reviewer posted and they turned out great. Not super crispy, but not just chewy. A good balance. The chocolate flavour was nice. Topped it off with some whipped cream and chocolate chips. This is definitely my new favourite waffle :) Thank your mom for us, Jenny!

I doubled the recipe, using whole wheat pastry flour instead of white, and added choc. chips. Made them in a belgian waffle maker that makes 4 toaster sized waffles - ended up with a ton of waffles that were tasty, better for you than breakfast cereal, and we take directly out of the freezer, toast in the morning, and eat in the car on the way to school. So good - getting ready to make a new double batch!
These were okay. I LOVE regular chocolate chip waffles, so I was hoping for more. I also added chocolate chips to mine.

Using a belgium waffle maker, this recipe only produced 4 waffles for me not 10. They are a dense, chewy waffle and not very chocolate flavored. I even separated the eggs and beat the whites before folding them into the batter (as I do with my other waffle recipes) but even that did not lighten up these waffles.
The taste was great and the icing made it even better! But for some reason the texture was all wrong. It was way to chewy. I won't be making these again.
